bib_record.title: Experimental cross sections of heavy residues produced in the reactions

free_txt: Rhodium targets were irradiated with
12C beam at energies ranging between 93 MeV to 400 MeV
at iThemba LABS (former National Accelerator Centre)
in Faure, South Africa.
The gamma activity induced in the target and
the catchers was measured for several weeks after the
irradiation by means of high efficiency HPGe detectors.
The uncertainties include:
The uncertainty in the thicknesses of the
target (up to 20%);
the uncertainty in thickness of the catchers (5
the uncertainty in the time-integrated b
(between about 5 and 10%);
the uncertainty of the HPGe efficiency (5%);
* The statistical errors.
Considering all the possible sources of error, the
uncertainty in the absolute values of the angle- and
range-integrated cross sections is estimated
to be about 25%.
Rhodium targets were irradiated with
12C beam at energies ranging between 93 MeV to 400 MeV
at iThemba LABS (former National Accelerator Centre)
in Faure, South Africa.
The 103Rh targets were thin (310 mu-m/cm2) foils
deposited on a 1.5 mu-m thick mylar backing.
Data from Dr. E.Z.Buthelezi
